title: ‘We were students negotiating with armed guerrillas for my father’s life’
description: When Miles Hargrove’s dad was kidnapped by Colombian guerrillas, he asked a young friend to act as negotiator.

title: Capturing 'the moment of decision'
description: Photographer Rory Lewis's portraits capture the quiet moment before a decision is made.

title: Irina Slavina: Final protest of Russian journalist who set herself on fire
description: Irina Slavina died in front of a Russian Interior Ministry building. Her friends say it was an act of protest.

title: Coronavirus: Bournemouth Symphony Orchestra resumes concerts
description: The Bournemouth Symphony Orchestra is resuming concerts and has sold thousands of online tickets.

title: US election 2020: The other 1,214 candidates running for president
description: What unites a concert pianist, an IT technician and a crypto billionaire? The 2020 White House race.

title: Coronavirus: Turkey farmers worried over downsized Christmas dinners
description: Turkey farmers are concerned the 'rule of six' will lead to downsized Christmas dinners.

title: Trump-aged Covid survivors on the president and the pandemic
description: Two Republicans with very different recovery stories to the president's - and differing views on him too.

title: Planet Mars is at its 'biggest and brightest'
description: The Red Planet is unmissable in the night sky right now as its orbit aligns with Earth's.

title: 'I wasn't expecting this' - Swiatek after journey from schoolwork to Grand Slam champion
description: Teenager Iga Swiatek says she "was not expecting" her French Open win after a journey from schoolwork to Grand Slam champion.

title: England have potential to win Euros and World Cup - De Bruyne
description: Belgium's Kevin de Bruyne says England should be contenders at next year's European Championship and the 2022 World Cup.

title: Covid: The latest on Trump's health in six graphics
description: How ill has the president been and is he better? These graphics help explain what we do and don't know.

title: ICYMI: A very expensive bikini, Chris Hemsworth and 11 Tasmanian devils
description: Some of the stories you may have missed this week.

title: Coronavirus: We won't surrender North to hardship, mayor vows
description: The warning comes amid plans to bring in a three-tier local lockdown system to slow the spread of Covid.

title: Premier League pay-per-view plan 'will drive fans towards illegal streams'
description: Broadcasting Premier League matches on a pay-per-view basis will lead to fans watching on illegal streams, says a football finance expert.

title: Unwanted cat brothers, 21, need 'twilight' Northamptonshire home
description: Black cats Leon and Nikita are "lovely boys" in need of a quiet "retirement home".

title: Britain's Hewett completes French Open double by winning singles title
description: Britain's Alfie Hewett wins his second title of the 2020 French Open by beating Belgium's Joachim Gerard in the wheelchair singles final.

title: Nagorno-Karabakh: Armenia and Azerbaijan shaky ceasefire in force
description: However, the two sides accused each other of fresh attacks less than an hour after the truce began.

title: Covid in Scotland: Bar workers dump leftover ice in closure protest
description: Tonnes of unused ice cubes are dumped in protest at Scottish government curbs on the hospitality sector.

title: 'Real and imminent' extinction risk to whales
description: A letter signed by hundreds of scientists calls for global action to protect whales, dolphins and porpoises.

title: Rashford becomes MBE & Foster receives knighthood in Queen's Birthday Honours
description: England and Manchester United footballer Marcus Rashford becomes an MBE in the Queen's Birthday Honours list.

title: Giro d'Italia: Simon Yates out of race with Covid-19
description: Britain's Simon Yates withdraws from the Giro d'Italia before stage eight after testing positive for coronavirus.

title: Transgender women in rugby union: Stonewall criticises World Rugby decision
description: An LGBT charity is "deeply disappointed" with World Rugby's ruling that transgender women should not play at the highest level of the women's game.

title: World Mental Health Day: Mural painted of Manchester icon Ian Curtis
description: A mural pays tribute to the lead singer of Joy Division in Manchester.

title: Virtual puppets promise glitch-free video calls
description: Nvidia says its AI-powered method can facilitate video calls on very slow internet connections.

title: White House hosted Covid 'superspreader' event, says Dr Fauci
description: The top US virus expert blames a lack of masks and no social distancing for an outbreak of cases.

title: Birthday Honours 2020: Marcus Rashford, Joe Wicks and key workers honoured
description: The Queen's Birthday Honours celebrate hundreds of people for their contributions during the pandemic.

title: Hurricane Delta makes landfall in storm-battered Louisiana
description: The state is still recovering from the damage caused by another storm, Hurricane Laura, in August.

title: US election: The American suburban women leading a ‘wine-fueled rebellion’
description: A group of suburban women in Ohio is rallying voters to try and swing the election in November.

title: Postnatal mental health: 'I was led by terror and fear'
description: A mum explains how she suffered with obsessive compulsive disorder after the birth of her daughters.

title: Luton Airport: Too many passengers at front of plane caused take-off issue
description: The type of plane for a scheduled flight was changed, but the seating plan was not, a report finds.

title: Covid-19: Father shares antibodies after daughter's death
description: Alan Mack believes he caught Covid-19 from his daughter, Rebecca, who died waiting for an ambulance.
